You are living in a time of dynamic change. And you love your country. And, yes, our doors are going to be open, and PERSON forbid DATE that they slam closed. But you have got an exciting future now, you DATE guy at some university there in GPE, and be part of the change, be part of what is happening in Eastern Europe or GPE. But if I were a kid, DATE now and were living in GPE, I'd say, PERSON, this is exciting. I can be a part of all this. May I have a last one? ENTITY, after your GPE visit, you will stop in GPE with the CARDINAL nations to discuss how to help the NORP and NORP economy. Would you give us an idea what you expect and how the West together help these CARDINAL nations? Well, I feel funny talking about it before I have met with them because the leaders of ORG are all very conscious of their own responsibilities and for their own economies and for working together -- for a decision coming out of ORG to be a joint decision. So, I do not want to get out in front of the others. that how the West can interact with GPE or with GPE will be a star item on our agenda. And it is not something that the GPE is forcing on to the agenda, as strong as I feel about it. It is something that we touched on at the last ORG meeting, actually, and that subsequently other leaders have indicated to us that they want to continue to discuss. I cannot tell you what I think will happen. A lot of the discussion will revolve around the multilateral support, I am sure, through multilateral agencies. And again, we come up against CARDINAL thoughts. CARDINAL is, what kinds of reforms are necessary for us to give all-out support from these multilateral institutions? ENTITY, by thanking you, let me ask a very last question. You got it. But you do not shout and wave your arms around. You said the cold war began in Eastern Europe; it will end there. What can we do for the NORP and your new junior partner, GPE, to have the cold war really end in Eastern Europe?
label: dialogic

metadata.title: George Bush Interview With Hungarian Journalists

text: And there, I think GPE-they have expressed their desire to get out of GPE, and I think we all should be encouraging them to make good on that statement and move as fast as possible to end an assault that has seen CARDINAL people have to flee their country as refugees and live in neighboring countries. And it is a brutal assault on the people who remain. We are seeing attacks on children-deliberately aimed at children by the use of weapons that are made to look like child's toys, but which, when picked up, cause either the death or the severe injury of the children. I recently had CARDINAL children in this office right here who'd been brought to our hospitals from GPE. And CARDINAL of them, a small, tiny girl, was horribly disfigured by burns. But the other CARDINAL were either missing a leg or an arm. Over DATE, GPE, irrespective of which political party is in power, has enjoyed a strong, special relationship with GPE, including an NORP military presence with nuclear weapons on NORP soft. Irrespective of the result of the general election now being fought in GPE, will you do everything in your power to maintain this relationship in general and specific terms? It is difficult for me to conceive of a time when we would not have the almost family relationship that we have between our CARDINAL countries. I have admired your Prime Minister and the progress that has been made in many fields there, but I know that I cannot go beyond that, because I am not going to, again, intervene or express an opinion with regard to your politics. But the relationship between our CARDINAL countries does go back DATE, and I think it would take more than an election in either CARDINAL of our countries to change that. ENTITY, may I go back a moment to the Persian Gulf?. People say, especially in ORG, that there is a danger of war. And in any case, confrontation with GPE could cause a resurgence in terrorism and dampen the peace process in the Middle East. Do you think these objections are true, and what do you expect the NORP to do to help you there? Specifically, what do you expect GPE, for instance, to do to help you? Well, in the economic summit DATE in GPE, we came to quite some sizable agreements with regard to terrorism and the cooperation between all of our countries on that. There is no question but that ORG does support terrorism.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Foreign Journalists Prior to the Venice Economic Summit

text: Governor PERSON, I am deeply grateful for your very kind and generous remarks. The Sun always shines in GPE. They came here in the snows of DATE over a trail marked with the blood of their rag-bound feet. The iron forge that gave this place its name had been destroyed by the NORP when General PERSON and his ragged NORP ENTITY encamped here exhausted, outnumbered, and short of everything except faith. We gather here DATE, the 200th anniversary of our independence, to commemorate their sacrifices even before we celebrate the glorious Declaration. NORP will remember the name of FAC as long as the spirit of sacrifice lives within their hearts. Here the vein of iron in our national character was forged. In DATE the colonial NORP was far more free and far more prosperous than his NORP cousin. NORP regarded us with some envy as appropriate subjects to share their grinding tax burdens. After FAC and FAC, the NORP generals were impressed with our marksmanship and fighting spirit, but they still dismissed GPE's militiamen as a rabble of arms. DATE, when he was DATE, a veteran of GPE was interviewed and asked why he took up his rifle against his King. Well, then, what did all the fighting mean? We had always governed ourselves, and we always meant to. Without PERSON's eloquence, those are the words of the NORP people's Declaration of Independence. That was the straight talk that brought CARDINAL ordinary NORP farmers, workers, tradesmen, and shopkeepers-into this valley of sacrifice in DATE. They did not die amid the banners and the fearful sounds of battle. They weakened slowly and quietly succumbed to cold, sickness, and starvation. Yet their courage and suffering those who survived as well as those who fell-were no less meaningful than the sacrifices of those who manned the battlements of GPE and scaled the parapets of GPE. In the battle against despair, PERSON and his men kept freedom's lonely vigil. The leader and the led drew strength and hope from one another. Around the DATE campfires that dotted these fields, the flame of liberty was somehow kept burning. Something happened at FAC. That ragged, starving ENTITY here emerged and changed in a way that can be sensed but never fully described. They suffered, they trained, they toughened, they buried their dead, and they stayed. They stuck it out.
label: monologic

metadata.title: Remarks in Valley Forge, Pennsylvania

text: That is a little different from the surveys I have seen and a little different from the attitude of the actual NORP I have talked to, but you are entitled to your opinion. ORG, I think, has one position, which is that it is seeing a lot of progress. But GPE has been up in revolt. I was just in a major firefight in GPE, hit by an ORG. But there is no question that ORG are dealing with the violent people. It is like this attitude about GPE. What you are watching is an NORP Government take care of extremists in their midst so that a democracy can survive. And it is essential that this democracy survive for our own security as well as the stability of the Middle East. You have talked about having a NORP-Palestinian peace agreement by DATE. What gives you hope that that is not overly ambitious? Because, first of all, people in GPE understand that in order for them to have long-term security, there has to be a democratic state. People in GPE want a democratic state. Secondly, I know their leaders. I spent a lot of time with Prime Minister PERSON and ENTITY PERSON. They are dedicated to doing the hard work. And yes, ORG was elected, and they have done a disaster in of running GPE. And it is that vision, the competing visions that will be put forth to the NORP people at some time. And I believe a state will exist, and I know it is necessary for peace in the Middle East. And I think I feel good that we can get it defined during my Presidency and implemented subject to roadmap. Going back to your vision and the message you have been pushing about democracy and supporting moderates across the region, if you look back over DATE, the Middle East that you will be handing over to the next ENTITY has is deeply problematic. You have ORG in power, ORG empowered, taking to the streets, more stronger than the Government, GPE empowered, GPE still at war. What we are handing over is a Middle East that, CARDINAL, recognizes the problems and the world recognizes them. They have been that is why we put them on the terrorist list before my Presidency. And what you are beginning to see is new democracies. You will see a NORP state. The freedom movement is a challenge to a system that said, the status quo is acceptable, when underneath was brewing all kinds of resentments.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Richard Engel of NBC News in Sharm el-Sheikh

text: If these CARDINAL logical disciplines can be wedded, it is then possible to create a situation of maximum military strength within economic capacities. If, on the other hand, these CARDINAL are allowed to proceed in disregard one for the other, you then create a situation either of doubtful military strength, or of such precarious economic strength that your military position is in constant jeopardy. It has been the purpose of this administration ever since it took office, finding itself confronted with a crazy quilt of promises, commitments, and contracts, to bring NORP military logic and NORP economic logic into joint strong harness. No more glaring illustration of the lack of balance between the military logic and the economic logic could possibly be found than the situation that existed when we took office. On the CARDINAL hand, we found our allies deploring our unfulfilled defense promises. On the other hand, we found there was a total carryover of MONEY in appropriated funds, largely committed, for which cash must be provided from revenues in future fiscal years, over and above the normal DATE cost of government. It is just as if the late administration had gone to the store and ordered MONEY worth of goods, which we have got to pay for as they are delivered, in addition to paying the regular household running expenses. The fiscal situation represented by these CARDINAL extremes absolutely has to be brought into some kind of realistic focus, and the only way to do it is to have a completely new, fresh look without any misleading labels. As you know, over DATE I have been involved in the NORP end of defense, and therefore I think I know all about paper divisions and cardboard wings. For DATE, I have been heavily involved in the NORP end of defense, and day after day have had to struggle with the basic equation that links the military safety of this country and of the free world with the ability of the world to pay its bills and earn a living. TIME I told the legislative leaders that already we can see our way clear to ask the ORG to appropriate CARDINAL less in new money for DATE than had been asked for by the previous administration. This is a preliminary figure based on DATE hard work. The great bulk of it, of course, relates to security programs. More definite figures will become available as appropriation requests are presented to the ORG during DATE. You will note that I have been talking about the new appropriations for DATE.
label: monologic

text: Yeah, I got through TIME of the thing and then started, you know, getting the hanky out and... Which you do not really do that much. You used to mock me for doing that. CARDINAL is talking about my daughters or seeing my daughters and the second is my team. I mea,n you remember after DATE when I went over to the campaign office and I saw all those kids who had been working so hard... and it was the same kind of emotion that stirs up this deep gratitude for their devotion and I think an appreciation that even though from their perspective, I am the one inspiring them, in fact all I am doing is drawing from their energy. They are the ones inspiring me. I am reflecting back what is inside of them, which is just a lot of goodness and a lot of heart and idealism . Well if-if they were here, what they would tell you is right back at you because you are the one who-I mean, everything has been organized around your energy and your sensibilities. And you know, we talked about this when you-when we talked about you running for president in DATE and DATE and I said to you we have not had a campaign that really spoke to the ideals of young people and aspirations for the future since PERSON. And that campaign stirred people in a way that very few have, and we did that-you did that, and you know, only you could have done it. And CARDINAL of the things that I tell people I appreciate is that-that spark, that thing that we took a flyer on in DATE, DATE. You know, it did not always manifest itself in the day to day grind of governing, but the truth is it is -it never died out. And I would continue to see it DATE in what happened here in the West Wing and the East Wing and FAC. The idealism and the dedication stayed with the staff and got us through some really hard times. And so, I do take a lot of pride in the fact that overall, this place never got cynical over DATE. There was gallows humor, but we-we never had that fire snuffed out and that is a point of pride for me because what that tells me is there is a whole generation of people who worked in this administration who are going to keep on doing stuff... I do not think they come away from this feeling like government service does not work...

text: You are violating the rules. What are you doing? And look, the state is going to enforce the rules, the state licenses bars and restaurants for a liquor license, state liquor authority. You can lose your liquor license. You lose your liquor license, that is serious. So I just wanted to make sure they knew the laws and the rules. I wanted to make sure they knew that the state was going to be sending out inspectors. And even their patrons do not respect it. The people of the state know what they did. They know the sacrifice they made over DATE to get that virus down. And they do not want anyone's irresponsibility to jeopardize that. I have been with people, somebody walks by does not have a mask, they are outraged. There are a lot of conscientious people who paid a very high price, did the right thing and they do not want other people ruining it for them. What kind of response did you get from business owners? They would say, We told people. Was their best response, but what does that mean? We told people? They are your patrons, in your establishment, you are responsible. ENTITY, how would social distancing be enforced on the bike path? Like any other path, like any other park, stay QUANTITY apart when you cannot wear a mask. Do you want to answer, ENTITY? As an example DATE, when we opened the path, we are going to have staff all across the shared use path to make sure reinforcing that people need to stay socially distancing. We also have signage out there as well. ENTITY, PERSON confirmed to us that several private schools have reopened under the phase CARDINAL religious gathering allowance. We have also have videos of CARDINAL of kids going in, buses with backpacks and masks. There is also another video we got a huge wedding at ORG DATE with CARDINAL in attendance. GPE says PERSON is in state's police's jurisdiction, why is not state police enforcing your executive order? Well, first, local governments have the primary responsibility for enforcement. And I have said a number of times, local governments have to do their job. I have taken responsibility for every bad decision and every unpopular decision, right? I am the one who sets all these rules. Everybody's angry at me. The CARDINAL thing I need the local government to do is actually enforce them.
label: dialogic

text: I think they ought to ask ORG to enact them into law now. If they do not want the ORG to regulate them, let us enact the law now. And I think that we ought to start DATE on this campaign together. If the tobacco companies really do not want kids to smoke, we can do this together. Are you going to try to bring back the cigarette tax? GPE has had a lot of success with that in their GPE. Well, this ORG would not adopt that. I have had a number of people who've come from tobacco countries suggest that some of the cigarette tax ought to be devoted to helping the farmers who want to convert their farmland to other purposes, to some sort of buy-out program. But I think that right now what we ought to do is-the bulk of the cigarette tax is available to the GPE, and a lot of the GPE now are passing cigarette taxes to help to pay for the health care bills of people who are suffering from tobacco-related illnesses. And I do not want to see the ORG and ORG crowd that out. So when I proposed a tobacco tax before, it was to pay for health care. Right now, advertising is written off as a business expense, and that means the public pays in some fashion for all advertising, including cigarette advertising. Would you consider getting rid of the tax deduction for cigarette advertising? You are the first person who is ever suggested it to me. I'd never though of that. So I will give you TIME to absorb it, and I will come back. I have never thought of that. Because I think a lot of people would be offended by the idea of paying for an unhealthy product to advertise and garner more smokers through it. But I will let you dwell on it. Not only do you want to regulate tobacco products, but you are also in favor of regulating how they are marketed. When a musician sits down to talk with me and they are smoking a cigarette, should I not air that footage on ORG? Should I ask PERSON to put out his cigarette before he does an interview with me? Should this go for all television? Because of lot of young people watch ORG. I think you should ask him to put it out because I think there are a lot of young people-- And I know he is an icon-for me, too. I do not know if he-his heart might stop if he does not have a cigarette.

metadata.title: Interview With Tabitha Soren of MTV

text: Why should we go back and try what failed before when what we are doing now is working and we need more change, not less? In closing, ENTITY, the broadcast media, some of them have been, I would say, almost brutal about your management style, but it is clearly working. Some other people are saying that your management style actually reflects sort of a new philosophy of management. I believe in, first of all, delegating to my ORG decisions that are made consistent with my policies but which do not need to be made here. I believe in making big policy decisions myself, after you get everybody in with the best possible ideas and let them argue them out. I think the idea that somehow a President should be able to know off the top of his head and be able to make a snap decision on how to reverse DATE of economic policies, DATE of stagnant wages, and DATE of social decline is a naive way of looking at things. And if you look at people-whatever people want to say about my management style, DATE, according to ORG, we got more done with ORG than any administration since World War II, except for President PERSON in DATE and President PERSON in DATE. We have reduced ORG when the NORP could not . We have increased the performance of ORG. So I think our management style is producing pretty good results. We have got NORP missiles that are no longer pointed at GPE for the first time since World War II. We have got a lot of things going. And I just think that part of it is, people think in patterns, and they think with preconceived notions of how decisions should be made. And a lot of our preconceived patterns are rooted in the organization of our thoughts and attitudes and actions that came out of World War II and the cold war. Now we are moving toward DATE, when things are changing much more rapidly, when it requires a whole lot of knowledge from different sources to make good decisions, and when you are dealing with problems that developed over a long period of time and therefore may need some period of time to solve. In that sort of environment, a whole different decisionmaking process has to take hold. And you need to deal with different kinds of people and work in different ways to make things happen. But I think if I get scored based on what we actually did, I will be satisfied.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Ellen Ratner

text: I think, ironically, that if you look at the values that immigrants bring when they come here - whether they are coming from GPE, or GPE, or now GPE, or GPE or GPE - the values they bring are quintessentially NORP values. They are striver's values; they are the values that say we are going to make something of ourselves, regardless of the station in which we were born. When you look at second-generation immigrants, or third-generation immigrants, they are as NORP as any kid here. That is part of what separates us from GPE or Europe, is we have had that tradition of being a nation of immigrants. And so, you know, when people are concerned about some of the changes that immigrants may bring, you know, they need to go back and read what people were saying about their grandparents or great-grandparents when they came. You read about the description of NORP who arrived, and the language that is being used is identical to the language that Mr. PERSON uses about NORP. You know, when NORP were coming instead of NORP, there was absolute certainty that GPE was going down the tubes because these swarthy, you know, folks were coming here and they had different attitudes. And NORP were coming, which meant that the pope was going to control us. And - this kind of xenophobia is part of the NORP tradition, and the good news is that, you know, after these spasms of it, it typically fades away, because the immigrants who come here, in fact, are coming here precisely to embrace the opportunities of being NORP. Is there a danger that GPE, after this Brexit vote, will turn inward, focus increasingly on its own problems and its own turmoil, and be less active in the world? Well, I think that the best way to think about this is a pause button has been pressed on the project of full NORP integration. I would not overstate it. There has been a little bit of hysteria post-Brexit vote, as if, somehow, ORG's gone and the trans-Atlantic alliance is dissolving and every country is rushing off to its own corner. What is happening is that you had a NORP project that was probably moving faster and without as much consensus as it should have.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview with Steve Inskeep of National Public Radio

text: I am indeed proud to join that company of men which has been awarded this medal during DATE since Mr. PERSON first accepted it. And that reminds me that DATE is just too long a time to elapse between NORP Presidents. And that is a sentiment which I think Mr. PERSON would share. Ladies and gentlemen, as I listened to the statistics with which I was overwhelmed by General--and we called him PERSON--I had the feeling it was a rather good thing he did not know all those figures, and give them to me somewhere along DATE. I would have been so impressed that I think my mind would have been taken off the war. And certainly it is enlightening, even at this late date, to find out exactly what such devoted and professionally competent people achieved. And indeed it was the confidence of military men that our technical and professional people could do this. That was at the bottom of the plan that came later to be known as Operation Overlord. This plan came finally to a preliminary state of completion in DATE. It was placed before General PERSON and all of the possibilities were explained to him, and he approved and later got the approval, of course, of the President and the NORP counterparts. But they also had the great faith that the NORP engineering profession could provide us the equipment and the materiel that would be needed, finally, for victory. There are CARDINAL or CARDINAL incidents that General PERSON did not mention. I am not going to go too deeply into statistics, but there is a story--a true one--that I thought always was interesting. The NORP engineers equipped with the kind of mechanisms such as he mentioned , went over to GPE; and there was a NORP air officer, General PERSON, a very competent and gallant man, who knew that the NORP needed a new fighter field fight close by. The only spot that was possible to use was an island and I think it was named Gozo, but if I am wrong General PERSON will tell me after we leave this meeting. But anyway it was nothing but a mountain. And the NORP having long ago given up with their hand tools on building this field, said to the engineer colonel visiting for the TIME, How long would it take you to get this field ready? And the NORP thought, at least, that anything DATE, if you could do it at all, would be all right. And this man took a look and said, Oh, DATE.
label: monologic

text: We talked about the response of ORG. And most importantly, we talked about the way forward. We talked about what we can do, working together, to move forward. And as a result of that first meeting, we found areas where we share common purpose, and we have resolved to work together in practical ways. But I do want to work with him, and that is what I am here to talk to you about. And so we have been working together in helping the citizens along the gulf coast recover from CARDINAL of the worst natural disasters in our Nation's history. You know, when we met, I told PERSON that I would work with the ORG to make sure we dedicated enough money to help the folks. He kind of looked at me like sure he is heard these political promises before. It is not the first time that he had heard somebody say, Well, we will work together to see if we cannot get enough money. And I suspect he might have thought, Well, he is just trying to get me out of FAC. But I meant what I said, and I want to thank ORG ORG for joining with the administration. We have committed MONEY to help the people in the gulf coast. That is money to go to build new homes, good schools. PERSON and I talked a lot about how do we make sure the contracting that goes on down there in the gulf coast goes to minority-owned businesses. The road to recovery is long and difficult, but we will continue to work together to implement the strategy that PERSON and I worked on, along with people other people like PERSON and other leaders. We have got a plan, and we have got a commitment. And the commitment is not only to work together, but it is a commitment to the people of the gulf coast of GPE to see to it that their lives are better and brighter than before the storm. We also worked together to ensure that NORP can take advantage of the new ORG drug benefit. Look, I understand that we had a political disagreement on the bill. I know that. But I worked with the ORG to make sure that DATE of seniors having to choose between food and medicine is over. And that is the case of this new ORG benefit. ORG pays PERCENT of the cost for our Nation's poorest seniors to get this new drug benefit. And I want to thank the ORG for recognizing that it is important to help our seniors sign up for this benefit.
label: monologic

text: That is off the record. No, that is on the record. I see a big microphone. I'd like to ask you about an issue they are raising back home, and it is not the DATE campaign. On ORG, I understand your position, but what I am unclear about is whether you are doing something to break the deadlock. Do you see yourself engaging with the other side, compromising? How do you compromise on something like granting liability for a telecommunications company? If we do not give liability protection to those who are helping us, they will not help us. And if they do not help us, there will be no program. What I am going to do is continue to remind people that unless they get this program done, we are going to be vulnerable to attack.  But I will just tell you, there is no compromise on whether or not these phone companies get liability protection. See, what the NORP people must understand is that without help from the phone companies, there is no program. And these companies are going to be subject to MONEY lawsuits by trial lawyers, plaintiffs' attorneys. And it is going to drive them away from helping us, unless they get liability protection, prospective and retroactive. It is just so important for people to understand the dangers. If we do not have the capacity to listen to these terrorists, we are not going to be able to protect ourselves. They have got enough votes to pass the bill in the ORG. So yes, I am going to talk about it a lot and keep reminding the NORP I am glad you asked the question, because this will give everybody a chance to know the dangers of the course that some in the ORG have put us on. And I will keep talking about it. The NORP people understand that we need to be listening to the enemy. GPE? I mean, are you going to send her back? the opposition. That is the dilemma; how you get CARDINAL people to sit down at a table and work on what is best for Africa I mean, for GPE. She was in the room with them. We got PERSON, who is plenty competent. I was going to say that, you know, the most effective way to get these issues resolved is for these leaders to feel pressure from their own people. And it is CARDINAL thing for PERSON and PERSON and people making phone calls, but GPE is a society; it is got a for example, GPE is the economic engine for East Africa.

text: Well, except that his suggesting that on sanctions that there should be a joint discussion of whether this should take place-but, yes, I appreciate very much, as I say, what he has said so far. ENTITY, you said in your news conference that you had irrefutable evidence about 's involvement in the GPE and GPE attacks. Now Mr. PERSON said that he would want to see more proof. DATE you are sending Mr. PERSON to Europe. Will he disclose to the NORP governments some of the evidence that you have? Yes, as a matter of fact, ORG has released quite a document now. Perhaps some of you have seen it; I know it is available to everyone. Now, that document is based on unclassified information. To go further with classified information would run the risk of revealing some of our sources and so forth-the type of thing you do not want to do. But I am sure that Mr. PERSON will be discussing with them this and whatever else can be released at that level to them about the information that we have. And there is not any question-a matter of fact, the unclassified document that you have makes it pretty evident that he is widely connected. We know for a fact that he is met a few times in DATE with PERSON. Are you disappointed by the NORP' attitude so far, and what kind of minimum cooperation do you expect from them? I recognize the problems they have in many of them with trade on a far larger scale than we have, but I have to say that I think there is a moral issue involved here with regard to a sovereign state that is so obviously resorting to terrorism literally against the world. And I am hopeful that, as they continue to consider this and learn more facts-and that is why Mr. PERSON's mission-that we may find that we can come together on isolating this outlaw among the world's nations. ENTITY, could I ask what your reaction would be to the suggestion by Senator PERSON that perhaps the time had come to consider assassination. No, I was quite surprised at that. You do not join them at their level; terrorism in response to terrorism is not the answer. This is what I am hoping that our friends and allies will consider.

text: What am I going to say to the small businesses who just decide, We cannot afford to provide healthcare to our employees? And what am I going to say to the NORP people when we start talking seriously about how we get our medium- and long-term deficits under control? So we have got big challenges. Not just around healthcare, but around the fact that we have an energy system that is archaic and involves us sending MONEY to other countries. We have got an education system that is starting to lag behind. And we have got a financial regulatory system that is completely inadequate to control the excessive risks and irresponsible behavior of financial players all around the world. At some point, we have got to take those on. Now part of the problem we have got is that a process in GPE to actually solve problems, to talk about them in honest ways, to think about people first and not the special interests and the lobbyists who have disproportionate power here. That system is broken and when people, during the course of us taking on CARDINAL of these problems like health care locks this process, it does not make them feel -- it does not make them feel real optimistic. But you are not on the campaign trail, now. You are right here in FAC. You are the head of this system. You promised transparency, putting the health care debates on C-span. People said he promised to get rid of earmarks. They look at the health care bill and see all these carve outs for GPE, for GPE. They say you are not living up to your promises. Well, look, there is no doubt that when I look back in the course of DATE, what I am constantly balancing is how do I move on these big agendas and at the same time, try to reform a system that has a lot of bad habits built up into them. So am I satisfied with the progress that we have made on changing how GPE works, absolutely not. text: And let me tell you what filters down to people like me, you know, aside from the esoteric proposals and figures and stuff that many of us do not understand, but what we hear is that the numbers we hear is that, for every $MONEY and so in new taxes, we are looking at about a MONEY or so in spending cuts. And that is true even though we have some targeted increases in investment, in education and training, and new technologies. Now, the people who argue this the other way, they play clever games. For example, if you are going to cut a program that is in place, you may have to phase in the cuts over a DATE period; if you raise a tax, you can raise a tax immediately. You have got to look at this whole budget. In this budget we have more spending cuts than tax increases. We do have some spending increases, but if you do not believe that there are differences in different kinds of spending, I do not know what we can do. We have some spending increases to give a nationwide apprenticeship program to help retrain the work force. We have some spending increases to get into new technologies to make up for defense cuts because we are losing a lot of high-tech, highwage jobs. You know, up in GPE we have had a lot of employment dislocation because of defense cutbacks, but you have got a whole highwage work force that needs to have something else to do. And every other government in the world is investing in new technologies to try to create those jobs for their people. If we do not do it, we are going to be left behind. So we have to target some investments. But this budget has over CARDINAL very specific budget cuts over the last budget adopted in the previous administration. text: DATE ORG faces a critical vote on the balanced budget amendment, and right now is the time for some straight talk about our national deficit. With our Federal debt averaging $MONEY for the typical NORP family of CARDINAL, I understand why the NORP people are fed up and why you are looking for change. I share your frustration, and I am determined to see things changed. I am convinced that a balanced budget amendment is the only way to force ORG, both the ORG and the executive branch, to live within its means. In fact, the very first address to ORG I made as President included a call for a balanced budget. I confidently presented a balanced budget constitutional amendment to the ORG. I asked our Nation's elected leaders to put GPE's best interests first and to join me in reaching a goal whose benefits will be measured in jobs and opportunity for ourselves and for our children. Government spending must be restrained and the budget balanced. Government is too big, and it spends too much. We are treating our national debt like the old fellow who borrowed money to pay off his loans. Inevitably, someone at some time must foot the bill. It is simply wrong to walk away from this mountain of debt and leave it to our kids. CARDINAL of our States have some kind of a constitutional requirement for a balanced budget. It is time for ORG to follow their lead. We must balance the Federal budget without shifting the funding burden along to the GPE. We must pay our own way. Our future is at stake. Now is the time to pass a constitutional amendment mandating a balanced budget. Let me caution NORP not to be taken in by bold blustering. We cannot wheel and deal the deficit away. There is no easy answer that we can jot out on a blank sheet of paper to wipe out a deficit of that magnitude. We should not be willing to risk our grandchildren's future on sound bites that merely sound real. A constitutional amendment mandating a balanced budget is what is needed. Pass this balanced budget amendment. There is no single action that we can take that will be any more important than doing this for our Nation's future. Thank you, and may PERSON bless you, and may PERSON bless GPE.

text: We are going to have a full agenda in DATE, but people should not underestimate how much we can get done. Dodd-Frank provided a platform to make sure that we end some of the most egregious practices and prevent another taxpayer-funded bailout. We have significantly increased capital requirements and essentially created a wind-down mechanism for institutions that make bad bets, so the whole system is not held hostage to them going under. We have to make sure that the rules issued around the Volcker Rule are actually enforced. So there is a lot of good work that will be done around Dodd-Frank. When investment banks, for example, were partnerships, as opposed to corporations, all those partners understood that if there was some tail risk out there - some unanticipated event that might result in the whole firm blowing up - that they were going to lose all their money, they were going to lose all their assets. If the surplus is MONEY, they propose to spend, what, MONEY on a tax cut, plus interest, and then MONEY to partially privatize ORG, and MONEY-those are big numbers. But if you think the surplus is MONEY and you spend MONEY on taxes, MONEY on privatizing ORG, and MONEY on spending, you are in deficit. That means higher interest rates. Do I want this big tax cut now and this privatization now, and do I think it will be so good that it is worth going back into deficits and having higher interest rates? I think from my point of view, the arithmetic here is very important, and it is really pretty simple. You can forget about all the zeros, and you just think that if you drop all the zeros, whatever you spend and whatever you cut taxes cannot add up to CARDINAL. If it does, you are not paying down the debt as you should. And the other thing that bothers me is, you see in these controversies we are having now, even when we have enough NORP here to have bipartisan support for bills, the leadership is well to the right of them. And if you have the President of the same party and these leaders in ORG, I do not know who would restrain them when it comes to what they would do in so many areas of our national life, and that bothers me.
label: dialogic

text: I have to say that the way events took place at GPE at the convention, I had a very definite feeling when it finally came down that way that that is the way it was supposed to be. Do you happen to remember anything that came up you would not mind sharing with me? I think we had to miss DATE.  And sometimes it is discussions of when there are visiting foreign ministers and so forth, that he will meet with them, perhaps, or entertain them while I am doing something else, in addition to participating in the meetings together. And then, he will bring me up to date on those things they have talked about. He'd be an asset to you, I would think, in some areas that perhaps you have had some problems with blacks, NORP, labor areas the administration would like to improve in. Would that outweigh any conservative opposition to him? I cannot believe that there is much of that left, because his record has been so obvious. Do you think he can do DATE of the kind of rigorous, on-the-road and then also not-while he obviously has been totally loyal to you, DATE of representing someone? Does he have the kind of personality that could I understand that, that there could come times when someone says, Enough. But I have been very conscious of what could be the difficulties in that, because there is no tried very hard to minimize them. You said you have done everything you possibly could, as well as your staff. Is it true there virtually have been no problems with PERSON and your staff? If you had to name CARDINAL area, what is the area he helps you the most in? It is so general, I do not think I could pin it down to CARDINAL. That is like asking CARDINAL fellows in a football game on the same team what part of the game did and under the best and it is just been a constant partnership. He also is playing an active role on the travel schedule, and that is something that on the travel schedule? In a sense, is he your eyes and ears at times or he has a little more freedom than you do He tells me experiences he is had out there, reactions of audiences, and so forth.

metadata.title: Interview With Katherine Lewis of the Houston Post About the Vice President

text: And I am just delighted to be with you DATE to celebrate the work of those wonderful NORP we call Points of Light. And I think our First Lady is a Point of Light. So I salute her for what she is done in literacy and helping this country understand the importance of reading. There is another guy here who is been a personal Point of Light to me, and that is PERSON, who many of you know. In a sense it was his dream and his dedication that made all this possible. I do not need to do it, but I will anyway. You said it all with your own lives. PERSON of ORG, PERSON of ORG, and PERSON of ORG . PERSON, what an inspiration he has been in this whole voluntarism concept; PERSON; also PERSON, who I hope is here with us DATE. What an honor it is to have PERSON here, PERSON, for helping make this event so very special. Anybody that can get up without a pitch pipe or a band and do what he did, we have got to look them over and see what makes him tick. But I will tell you, his song said it all; his song got right to the heart. And I understand that he is just been nominated for his seventh Grammy Award. And Presidents ought not to do this, but I know who I am rooting for. But above all, PERSON and I wanted to come over and thank the Points of Light that we are honoring DATE. I know that many of them have gone to great efforts to get here. And lots of folks ask me about the phrase, Points of Light. And some say it is religion; others say, well, it is a patriotic theme, like the flag; and others think it is an image of hope. But I think that Points of Light are all of these things and yet still something more. It is what happens when ordinary people claim the problems of their community as their own. And it is the inspiration and awakening to the God-given light from within, lit from within, and it is the promise of GPE. We have got Points of Light here DATE from CARDINAL GPE, shining all the way from GPE to GPE, GPE to GPE. Each of you here DATE knows what I mean by that. Each of you found within yourselves your own special genius for helping others.
label: monologic

metadata.title: Remarks at a Celebration of the Points of Light

text: I have noticed that PERSON has also had to deal with PERSON and has done so in a very respectful but firm way. And I admire the way she is handled her diplomacy. She has proven herself to be a very strong leader. And for that, I am grateful, and I hope the NORP people are as well. ENTITY, your administration, you just said, offers a lot to GPE to gain acceptance, GPE's acceptance to idea building--missile shield. And at the same time, so far, it does not seem that you offer much to GPE, which is supposed to host the interceptor site. How would you convince people in GPE, who are frankly not that much afraid of uranium threat, but they are listening to the threats from GPE very carefully? First of all, GPE and the GPE are in ORG, and an attack on one is an attack on all. We cannot offer any better security agreement than that, and we mean it. If you are an ally of GPE and ORG and you feel threatened by an outside force, we will help you. I do not believe that there would be-I would certainly hope that GPE will not be threatened again by an outside force. I can understand why people in GPE could be nervous about that. After all, it is been a terrible part of your history. But as an ally in ORG, I cannot make a stronger statement than to say we stand with you, and in this case, this ally actually means it, and so do ORG allies. You know, I am sure there is probably some skepticism from some older folks or those who study history, where GPE had been given assurances and those assurances did not come through. Well, in this case, they will. I do not view GPE as being under any military threat. Obviously, there are differences you have with GPE over meat, and I am very aware of that. It is an ORG matter; it is a matter that PERSON is working hard, as the head of the ORG at this point in time, to address that problem. The best way to compensate GPE for our friendship is to have good, strong bilateral relations. As you know, we have worked hard on different agreements that would help create jobs. It is really the best thing that a relationship can do, is yield tangible benefits for people besides peace and security. And job creation and decent-paying jobs benefit society as a whole. And we will keep it that way.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Foreign Print Journalists

text: As you know, head of ORG inquiry, PERSON, will present his report to ORG in DATE. How should the international community respond if the report concluded that GPE did not fully cooperate with the inquiry, as previous efforts did? Our position is, is that we want to know the truth, and we expect all parties to be forthcoming with the truth. The truth is really important to help GPE meet a goal that we want for GPE, which is free of foreign interference, democratic and peaceful, so that people can realize dreams and so the great country of GPE can grow and prosper like I am confident it can. So GPE will constantly remind all parties that we seek the truth, and we expect parties, when asked about the truth, to be forthcoming with the truth. I am worried about people who stall and hope that the world turns a blind eye to a terrible death. And we are not going to turn a blind eye. We will keep focused on this important issue, because we believe in the future of GPE. From what you say, many in GPE fear that there might be a deal between GPE and GPE. In other words, if GPE complied with GPE demands regarding GPE, regarding ORG and ORG, would you let the inquiry not reach its ultimate? Part of our desires for GPE is, of course, to shut down terrorist bases in their country, and is, of course, to stop cross-border infiltration into GPE, is, of course, to stop allowing people to find safe haven to plot and plan attacks in the neighborhood. But part of our demands was to-was CARDINAL, which is, completely out of GPE. We are people who believe that when we say something, we have got to keep our word. I think that the light of truth is very important toward establishing a peace that we all want in the region. I really do want young boys and girls in GPE to be able to grow up in a world free of violence. GPE is a fabulous country; GPE is one of the great international cities of all time. And it is in the world's interest that this democracy survive, and not only survive but flourish and thrive. And so we do not -we really are not going to deal away GPE's future. Yes. and you have demanded repeatedly that GPE should implement this resolution. Will you give ORG a chance to resolve this issue through national dialog, or you will exercise more pressure?
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Diana Moukalled of Future Television of Lebanon

text: It is a great pleasure to be here in GPE, and I thank you very much, PERSON, for those overly generous words. I can assure you in DATE I will do my utmost to live up to those high standards that you have set, and I will give my best efforts to not disappoint you in any way whatsoever. I was looking at the records DATE, and I have been in GPE CARDINAL times in DATE. The last time I was here was in DATE. At that time, PERSON assembled CARDINAL of his closest friends to meet me at the GPE DATE celebration. It was a great occasion, and I enjoyed it very, very much. You gave me a very, very warm welcome at that time, and I certainly appreciated that enthusiastic reception. But let me say I am especially pleased to be here and have an opportunity to say a few things that I feel very strongly and very deeply concerning your fine Congressman, PERSON. While I am here, I think it appropriate that I say a few words in a salute to some of the other distinguished guests who are here. First, I think it is a very opportune time for me to wish PERSON mother a very happy birthday, which I understand will take place DATE. PERSON and PERSON are well known in GPE because of their very well-known son. PERSON is every bit as proud of you, Mrs. PERSON, as I am sure you are of him. It would be redundant, but I feel so strongly I want to compliment you on your outstanding Governor, PERSON. But I likewise would feel it very appropriate for me to compliment you on one of my dearest and finest friends in the ORG, PERSON and, of course, PERSON. PERSON and I served on ORG together for DATE. And I know what a superb job he did, what a hard struggle he made DATE after year after DATE to try and get some sense and responsibility in the consideration of the various appropriation bills, but particularly the ORG and ORG appropriation bills. And believe me, that is not an easy job. So, PERSON and PERSON, it is great to see you. Let me also put in a good word for PERSON and PERSON and ORG ORG, GPE. I wish them the very best.

metadata.title: Remarks in Charlotte at a Reception Honoring Representative James G. Martin of North Carolina.

text: The first question, obviously, is about GPE. You were in GPE DATE. I saw you on the FAC with your wife, TIME. And you spoke with the new Prime Minister, Mr. PERSON. So my question is, how is your sense about Mr. PERSON and his policy and the implementation of his policy-the first new government in GPE? Well, my sense was that he had given a lot of thought to what he wished to do and that he was bringing a great deal of energy to the task and that he was determined to pursue a course of economic revival for GPE and to maintain a strong democratic tradition and that, in terms of our relationships, that the traditional strong relationship between GPE and GPE would be maintained vigorously. May I follow up with a question that connects to GPE very quickly? We are in the front line. And CARDINAL of the first requests of the government of GPE, Mr. PERSON's government, was to let GPE get in the contact group that is working in GPE. Do you think this request will be evaluated, accepted, on what? Let me say first, I think that GPE should be very closely consulted about all developments in GPE and in the former GPE. In other words, if the membership were expanded, would every country that has troops there-GPE has troops there, would they have to go into the contact group? Would other countries that border the former GPE and have intense interests there-GPE is sending troops there-have to be put into the contact group? Excuse a parochial question, but as you know, we have had CARDINAL trade agreements in DATE between GPE and GPE. And yet, our trade problems seem to be deteriorating, if anything, over softwood lumber and wheat and now Pacific salmon, so much so, that our Trade Minister, PERSON, has warned of a trade show between our CARDINAL countries. And even your Ambassador to GPE has criticized GPE actions on wheat. Do you think the time has come for you to become personally involved on this issue before it deteriorates much further? First of all, keep in mind, this is the biggest bilateral trading relationship in the world, as far as I know. And in one that big, it should not be surprising that there would be some frictions from time to time.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Foreign Journalists

text: The MONEY that had been held in arrears was released, and the process of talking about more money going through, CARDINAL workers now that were not allowed in GPE now allowed in GPE. In other words, what I am telling you is, is that it is important for the life of the NORP to improve in measurable ways. And as confidence is built, as institutions are in place, I assured Prime Minister PERSON-and this was important for Prime Minister PERSON to hear as well-that there is going to be a lot of help, financial help, from around the world. Let me just go around the table. I am cautious, because- and I am cautious because history tells you to be cautious. I do not know where you were in DATE. There are people who have declared their-openly declared their hostility to GPE and their desire to destroy NORP citizens. There are people that, you know, would rather have chaos than a state. And on the other hand, we have now got a partner in peace, Prime Minister PERSON, who is-wants the tools necessary to chase them down. It is going to be one of the accountability measures, by the way. That is CARDINAL of reasons why we put PERSON. The news DATE, of course, from our side was, besides having the meeting, was Ambassador PERSON and his team. It is PERSON and a team of people that the Secretary will be glad to explain to you. We have a security team there to help the PERSON. Their job is to find out what is needed and to also hold people to account, both sides to account, reminding people of promises made in meetings and insisting them that in order for progress to be made, people have got to deliver it. And so, yes, I have cautious, but optimistic. ENTITY, previous efforts at making peace in the Middle East did not succeed. You believe you now have a chance. Could you try to put this in history? What do you think has changed since you took office, and how did we get to this point? I think a couple of things have changed. CARDINAL, I think there is-I think Prime Minister PERSON is willing to make the necessary decisions and take the necessary steps to fight terror and to develop institutions necessary for a state to emerge, a genuine effort.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Members of the White House Press Pool

text: I hope you will also send that good NORP that was just introduced to you, Mr. PERSON, to ORG. He impresses me as being a wonderful man. The best thing, you know, for your own safety, is to just vote the NORP ticket and send them all in. I urge you most strongly to vote for our candidate for President and Vice PresidentPERSON and PERSON. I think it would be a tragedy for the present NORP candidate to be elected President of GPE. He has been a great general, but he has already shown in this campaign that he cannot be depended on to master the great political issues with which we are faced. He has surrendered to the most reactionary elements of ORG. He is not the kind of man we ought to have for President. Now I like him. I made him Chief of Staff of the GPE ENTITY. I sent him to Europe to command the ORG military setup, and I have every confidence in him as a military man. But as President and politician, he would not know what to do. Now, on the other hand, I am more than ever impressed DATE with what PERSON offers to the ORG. He is talking sense to the NORP people. And he will not be taken in by any special interest lobby. If you elect him and a NORP ORG, the country will be safe for DATE. Again I want to thank you very much for this most cordial welcome. I appreciate that greeting very, very much. I am glad to be back here in GPE once more. I was here in DATE and gave you some down to earth facts about that good for-nothing, do-nothing NORP 80th ORG, if you remember. Then you did your duty at the polls, and I want to congratulate you on the way you voted. I understand GPE had the best record of any county in GPE in the vote you gave ORG in DATE. And I hope you will repeat that again. I am sure you will do it over in DATE, and send PERSON to ORG. I have always been interested in the way your good town got its name. They tell me that FAC was named for the helper engines that pull the train up these wonderful mountains you have around here. You know, I think ORG needs some helper engines.
label: monologic

metadata.title: Rear Platform Remarks in Utah and Colorado

text: The NORP agreed to CARDINAL for us, but not CARDINAL for them. Incidentally, I want you to know also that SDI and the research that is going forward is not just aimed at strategic weapons, such as a protection for ourselves. It would be very definitely a factor with regard to those SS20's, those NORP intermediate-range weapons, for protection of the allies. Yes, ENTITY, we are going to have very soon in GPE local elections, and ORG has said that if it should win those local elections, it would give them a political, national meaning. And they would want to be in charge of the government, to put a crisis on the GPE government and have a new government headed by NORP. How would you feel about that? They were talking about ORG and all of this. How would you feel about the NORP taking the leadership in GPE? Well, if you look at any country in the world that is run by a NORP government, you see that the people are denied all the democratic rights that we and our societies have come to believe are democracy and are the rights of the people. I cannot quite believe that the NORP people, with their love of independence and freedom, would settle for what the NORP government would mean to them and would take away from them. But if it does, from what I know of your people, I would think the NORP might get a rude surprise when they started to implement their ideology. It seems that Europe is at a balance. You have asked Europe to take responsibility on the economic side, and it is also a quite balanced point of equilibrium from the political side. And how do you feel about a unified NORP monetary system to balance the general equilibrium? Oh, I do not know that I want to get into things that are purely- But it seems to me that, as you so graciously said about the alliance and its closeness now, it seems to me that there is a greater bond-certainly in Western Europe, which is all we can talk about-a bond, between the countries than I can remember in my rather long lifetime, a friendship, and now with the ORG that I will be addressing there that represents all the countries of Europe, elected directly by all the people of Europe, and ORG-all of these things I think represent great progress. NORP monetary system. I just do not feel that I could comment on that. I have not done any study on my own of what that could mean or what the problems might be.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Foreign Journalists

text: I one day told PERSON, I was joking, but I told PERSON I said, PERSON, you have got all those savings; you should play politics. You should leave them in the budget and then reluctantly give them up when they start telling you to cut the budget. Well, if people like PERSON and PERSON do not hold their fire, what are you going to do? Well, I am going to have to fight back, because, first of all, the bulk of the defense budget is for personnel and readiness. We have men and women in uniform in our volunteer military that DATE, it was a disgrace. We were acting as if we were still in a war and they were draftees. Those with families found themselves eligible for welfare. Now we have increased the pay for those people to something comparable with what they are doing. And yet even here, in this budget, we are asking them to make a sacrifice and not take a cost-of-living pay raise, as we are asking the civilian employees. And I regret that very much, that we have to do that, because we are just getting them up to something that is fair, at least. Now, that leaves, if they are going to cut, they are going to have to cut in weapons systems, and these are the least of the spending. You will get very little savings in proportion to the deficit we are trying to hold down if you wiped out all the vehicles and all the airplanes and even the reserve ammunition that we are seeking to buy, to say nothing of ships and planes. There are some people who say, on the deficit issue, that you have intentionally been rather overly cautious and that you expect a much rosier picture down the road, and therefore you will not have as high deficits. Well, what we are trying to do because we do not want to get engaged in a debate up on the ORG that we are as is sometimes in the past they have tried to do-their saying that we were coming up with rosy estimates. And to get in that argument, what we have to look at is that among all the experts, all those who project economic estimates, there is a wide range of difference. Now, you cannot say some are more expert than others; so you have to say there is real leeway in there. So, we have looked at what the most pessimistic say about the recovery, what the most optimistic say.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Jerry Boyd of the St. Louis Post-Dispatch on Domestic and Foreign Policy Issues

text: And that is why the battle-the stakes are so high in GPE right now. By the way, GPE is a front in the war on terror. And it is important for people to understand that, because the war takes place elsewhere. And in-one of the reasons that people say, in the NORP world-obviously there was your landmark speech DATE-but in the NORP world, that you will not really be able to address the balance against GPE until GPE is seen not to tilt towards GPE in the Middle East. What do you think about that? I think it is an excuse, because GPE-I am the first ENTITY ever to go to ORG And say, two-- No President has ever said that. And I said it, and I said it with conviction, because I believe it is in GPE's interest that there be a peaceful NORP state, and I know it is in the NORP' interest. However, to achieve a peaceful NORP state, the emergence of a peaceful NORP state, a state where people are willing to risk capital, a place where people are willing to develop an economy, there must be a focused effort to defeat terror. I went in and embraced, in GPE, GPE, PERSON. And the reason I did so, PERSON, is because he came to FAC and he said, I will join you in the fight against terror. We are not going to allow the few to destroy the hopes of the many. As well, I could sense in his talk, in his feeling, that he has-he is got great trust in the NORP people. In other words, given the chance, the NORP people will develop the habits of democracy, and out of that will come a great state, a peaceful state. And I trusted him, and we were working with him. We were making good progress. And I was working with PERSON. I gave a speech on DATE, which says, All of us have responsibilities, and you, GPE, have a responsibility. Do you think PERSON could ever emerge as a man of peace? I believe he wants peace for his people. I mean, he is a man who has presided over suiciders, where he has to go to the funerals of women and children because some cold-blooded killer is trying to destroy the hopes of all the people in the region. And I believe he believes in a NORP state.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sir David Frost of BBC Television

text: We need less regulation for businesses and small businesses. And we have got to deal with rising health care costs. Rising health care costs are making it difficult for some entities to hire people. Rising health care costs affect all NORP. Rising health care costs create insecurity in our GPE. And so we need to continue the focus on costs. We are making some good progress, by the way, about helping people with health care. We have got what we call community health centers in GPE. I am committed to the expansion and the building of new community health centers. These are places where people who do not have insurance or live in areas without enough doctors can find health care. Community health centers make sense. It takes the pressure off the emergency rooms of hospitals such as this. We have opened or expanded CARDINAL community health centers since DATE. This is a good way to make sure that health care is available for those who do not have insurance yet. And so I call upon ORG to look at that part of my budget and continue working with the administration to expand these vital centers around GPE and around GPE. And then we worked on ORG. You might remember what it was like before DATE when people talked about ORG. If somebody would talk about it, somebody else would say, Wait TIME. They are going to try to take away ORG from the seniors. I felt like we needed to deal with the issue now and not pass it on like other Congresses and administrations had done. It is time to address the issue before it became so acute that the system did not work. And it was time to fulfill a promise to our seniors, and so we acted. I was proud to sign that bill, and as I told the ORG, If you try to change it and it hurts our seniors, I will veto the bill. It is going to take a while to implement the ORG bill. It is a complex piece of legislation. After all, it is the first modernization since PERSON signed ORG in DATE. DATE, seniors are going to get a drug discount card, which will save them PERCENT off the retail price of most prescription drugs. And the lowest income seniors will get a $MONEY credit. That will help seniors with drug costs. Secondly, DATE we will begin preventive screenings against diabetes and heart disease for seniors just entering ORG, plus they will get a wellness exam. It is the first time that ORG has actually been into the business of preventive screenings.
label: monologic

metadata.title: Remarks in Little Rock, Arkansas

text: And so the fact that there were some who voiced doubts about this approach was invaluable, because it meant the plan was sharper, it meant that we had thought through all of our options, it meant that when I finally did make the decision, I was making it based on the very best information. But as I said, you know, there were sufficient risks involved where it was not as if any of the folks who were voicing doubts were voicing something that I was not already running through in my own head. You know, we understood that there were some significant risks involved in this. How much did some of the past failures, like the GPE hostage rescue attempt, how did that weigh on you? I thought about that. No, I mean you think about Black Hawk Down. You think about what happened with the NORP rescue. And it, you know, I am very sympathetic to the situation for other Presidents where you make a decision, you are making your best call, your best shot, and something goes wrong -- because these are tough, complicated operations. DATE I was thinkin' about this quite a bit. It sounds like you made a decision that you could accept failure. You did not want failure but after looking at . . . the CARDINAL thing that you mentioned, you must have at some point concluded that the advantages outweighed the risks . . . . And the reason that I concluded it was worth it was that we have devoted enormous blood and treasure in fighting back against ORG. And so part of what was in my mind was all those young men that I visited who are still fighting in GPE. And the families of victims of terrorism that I talk to. And I said to myself that if we have a good chance of not completely defeating but badly disabling ORG, then it was worth both the political risks as well as the risks to our men. How much of it was gut instinct? Did you have personal feelings about whether . . . . The thing about gut instinct is if it works, then you think, Boy, I had good instincts. If it does not , then you are gonna be running back in your mind all the things that told you maybe you should not have done it. Obviously I had enough of an instinct that we could be right, that it was worth doing. After you made the decision to go ahead, you had like DATE where you were you surveyed the tornado damage in GPE.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Steve Kroft on CBS 60 Minutes

text: And they will still be a military power that is far weaker than GPE and for that matter, will be weaker than GPE. And so, in DATE time, whoever is occupying my chair here in FAC will have more information about their nuclear program, will have greater international legitimacy in the event that the President needs to initiate a strike against GPE's nuclear program, will have the justification of them explicitly having violated international agreements that they entered into. And so the notion that somehow we are better off confronting that problem right now, rather than having DATE in which to monitor, learn about their program and be assured that they do not have a nuclear weapon does not make much sense. There is no scenario in which, in the absence of a nuclear weapon, GPE will be able to match GPE, GPE and its various Gulf allies if they tried to break out and get a bomb. We hope that by virtue of them interacting with the world's community on a more regular basis commercially, that that may moderate their behavior, but we are not counting on it. And the backstop to this agreement throughout is that we, GPE, are not giving up any of our capacity to respond if and when they pose a national security threat to us or they pose a national security threat to our friends and allies in the region, particularly GPE. So let us talk about GPE for a moment. Unquestionably, your administration has given unprecedented military and strategic support to GPE. But it is also apparent that the relationship in many ways between GPE and GPE, between the governments and even, in some cases, between some peoples, has grown toxic. And I am wondering now, looking forward, what do you think the NORP government can do to repair this? What can your administration do? And what can NORP NORP do? The relationships between our peoples, the shared values, the shared commitment to democracy , those things are so deep that they have survived arguments in the past and they will survive this argument. And so I understand the anxiety that it causes. But I think a testament to how sturdy the relationship is, is that despite this very significant policy disagreement, all the military, security, commercial, cultural cooperation that existed before this debate came up has continued unabated and will continue unabated.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview with Jane Eisner of FORWARD

text: We are pretty much all agreed upon our participation in the international funding groups such as ORG, ORG, and so forth. And I think we honestly are going to come together in an effort to find ways that we can have that convergence I mentioned, where we can try to go forward together in the policies that we are following to get over inflation. If CARDINAL country is going to practice great inflation, their dollar is going to be weak. And currencies are going to be stabilized when we conquer inflation. In our country, a lot of people think we could have lived with this. The cruise missile is an in-flight vehicle that would be in the air, you might say, in TIME and is, therefore, subject to the same kind of conventional defensive weaponry-anti-aircraft type weaponry, picked up on radar and aimed by radar and so forth-that an airplane would be. text: I think one of the reasons that ORG has been so forthright about this health care reform issue is that you see it from the grassroots up in human terms and you do not get so hung up as some people do on all the political rhetoric and the positioning and the characterizations that have, frankly, put a lot of Members of ORG at a severe disadvantage because they have not had the chance to spend the time and make the effort to deal with this issue that you have. It is PERCENT of our income, and for people who do not live in it DATE, it can be a very difficult thing. But I just wanted to thank you because I believe that the personal experiences you have shared, so many of you, common to the ones that my own mother shared, really animated ORG to take the position that you have taken. I want to emphasize DATE that what I seek, contrary to the attacks, and what you have sought, is not a Government-run health system, it is a private insurance health system that covers everybody, where the health care professionals run it and not the insurance companies. That is what we seek. We seek private insurance that can never be taken away. It is wrong to treat seriously ill children in an emergency room who could have been treated more easily and more inexpensively if their parents had just had the coverage. With our reforms, every family will have that kind of quality insurance. We ought to reform the insurance system that DATE often only covers the healthiest people and even then will deny them coverage for anything they have been sick with before. When you go to a patient's bedside, you ask, Why does it hurt? If you think about all this preexisting condition business, there are CARDINAL NORP who live in families where there is been a child with diabetes or a mother that had cancer prematurely or a father that had an early heart attack or some other problem. I see these people everywhere. Now, we get action lickety-split up here all the time when CARDINAL people or CARDINAL people are adversely affected by something if they are well organized. But these CARDINAL people, they are professionals and blue-collar workers; they are old folks and young folks; they are all different kinds of people; and they are by definition disorganized. text: I am pleased to announce that I intend to nominate PERSON to be the next Secretary of ORG. Our Nation's transportation infrastructure is vital to our prosperity and competitiveness; it is critical to the everyday lives of our citizens. The Secretary of ORG is responsible for maintaining a safe, reliable, and efficient transportation system. In addition, the Secretary of ORG plays an important role in our Nation's coordinated efforts to guard against terrorist threats to our aircraft, our seaports, and our infrastructure. It is the job that requires vision and strong leadership. PERSON is the right person for this job. She brings a lifetime of experience on transportation issues, from both the private and public sectors. She now serves as a senior executive for transportation policy at a major engineering firm. Before that, PERSON served in my administration as the head of ORG. As Administrator, PERSON led efforts to improve safety and security, reduce traffic congestion, and modernize GPE's roads and bridges. And before coming to GPE, PERSON served in ORG for DATE, rising through the ranks to become the director in DATE. PERSON has a reputation for character and common sense. She knows how to set priorities and to solve problems. And as a member of my ORG, PERSON will work closely with ORG and local leaders to ensure that GPE has a state-of-the-art transportation system that meets the needs of our growing economy. When confirmed by the ORG, PERSON will succeed CARDINAL of our Nation's finest Secretaries of Transportation in PERSON. When I came to GPE, I asked PERSON to continue his service by joining my ORG. And he shows that when we put politics aside, people from different political parties can work together to achieve results for the NORP people. He was the Secretary of ORG on DATE, and he led the unprecedented effort to bring CARDINAL of passengers aboard commercial aircraft to safe landings. And since then, he is worked to strengthen the security at GPE's airports and seaports. He is played a critical role in keeping GPE safe from terrorist attacks. PERSON also worked hard to modernize the aviation market. And after Hurricane Katrina, PERSON and his team swung into action to repair and reopen major highways and seaports and airports and pipelines along GPE's gulf coast. PERSON has served GPE with integrity and dedication and distinction. He leaves office as the longest serving Secretary of ORG in our Nation's history.

And yet if you are an individual, like ENTITY out there as an independent contractor, and you buy your own health insurance, you are at a tax disadvantage. And so I am asking the ORG to reform the tax code to treat everybody fairly. And in my judgment, such a plan will encourage and enable more individuals to be able to buy health insurance, which will help us deal with the uninsured. Will the budget be balanced through spending restraint or taxes? The budget is going to be balanced by keeping taxes low. In other words, we are not going to raise taxes. And as a result of keeping taxes low, the economy is doing just fine, and when the economy is doing well, it yields a certain level of tax revenues that we can live with. And then making sure that we constrain federal spending, and you do that by setting priorities. And our priority has got to be this global war on terror and supporting our troops, and protecting the homeland, and that is what our budget will say, and we can balance the budget within DATE. And that is going to be - that is good for the country. And in so doing, we are dealing with the short-term deficits, but we have also got to deal with the long-term deficits inherent in, for example, programs like ORG and ORG.
